item.title: Mechanical Fitter
item.description: Join PRA and set yourself in the direction for success! Great team, endless support and fantastic employee benefits!
item.job:description:
The Perth Region Alliance (PRA) is a partnership between Programmed and the Water Corporation to operate and maintain Perth's water, wastewater and drainage networks, which range from Yanchep and Two Rocks to Mandurah.

A full time fixed term, 11 month opportunity has arisen within the Construction Delivery team in Canning Vale for a Mechanical Fitter. The purpose of the role will be to support the Construction Delivery team by safely delivering in-house project construction activities within the agreed project timeframes and ensuring that works are managed to a safe, successful and profitable outcome to the customers' satisfaction.

To be successful in the role, we will be looking for relevant qualifications as outlined below: 

  • Mechanical Fitter trade certificate (Certificate III or equivalent as minimum)
  • Diploma of Engineering – Advanced Trade or Equivalent (desirable)
  • Current national "MR" class driver's license (HR desirable)
  • Working at heights
  • Confined space certification / SCBA – 2 day nationally accredited course
  • Current "Dogman" certificate
  • Senior First Aid (desirable)

 The ideal candidate will also possess the following: 

  • Awareness of and a strong commitment to OSHE procedures and standards
  • Significant experience in the construction and delivery of water and wastewater related assets
  • Significant experience in working with pumps, valves and piping
  • Proven experience in field testing and commissioning of water and wastewater related assets
  • Proficient in the use of lathes and other industry related machining equipment
  • Significant trades experience
  • Demonstrated computer skills and proficiency with e-mail, internet and Microsoft Office applications

All interested parties are encouraged to apply.

Programmed provide a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits, including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply.

item.title: HSE Manager - VIC / TAS
item.description: Join our team and put your HSE supervisory experience to use in an environment with endless opportunities!
item.job:description:
Programmed Skilled Workforce is a leading provider of managed labour, labour hire, staffing and training services.

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an experienced HSE Manager to join our team based in Hawthorn.

This role will be reporting to the Executive General Manager HSEQ and functionally to the General Manager VIC / TAS / NZ.

The successful applicant will be responsible for but not limited to:

  • Managing a team of HSE Coordinators and supporting our operational teams and field employees in the achievement of our vision of Zero Harm. 
  • Application of our core HSE management processes, driving a strategy to improve the HSE performance of the region,
  • Liaising with external and internal stakeholders to influence positive HSE outcomes, performing client / site risk assessments, and
  • Supporting the coordination of workplace injuries and worker's compensation are the main characteristics of the role. 

You will also be involved in the provision of training and inductions to ensure that Programmed employees are placed, operate and work in a safe and sustainable manner.

To be successful, you will have experience/qualifications in:

  • Diploma (Occupational Health & Safety), alternatively proven experience in HSE
  • Auditor or Lead Auditor in OH&S systems (Desirable)
  • Certificate IV in Workplace Training and Assessment (Desirable)
  • A thorough understanding of OHS legislation and requirements of ISO 9001, AS 4801 and ISO 14001
  • Developing and driving HSE improvement strategies demonstrating tangible improvements
  • Proven ability to develop, implement and maintain Integrated Management Systems
  • Experience in multi industries ranging from heavy engineering, manufacturing, rail, maritime and FMCG
  • Applying internal Standards and Policies
  • Identifying and influencing positive HSE outcomes to issues and conflicts
  • ICAM or related investigation techniques
  • Ability to prepare concise management reports
  • Lateral thinking ability with high problem solving skills
  • Implementing and coordinating change management programs and initiatives
  • Effective interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
  • Effective supervision and people management skills
  • Ability to travel at relatively short notice both inter and intrastate

This exciting opportunity offers an attractive salary, exposure to a range of industry sectors and the opportunity to make real contributions in the health and safety arena.

If you feel you meet the above requirements and seek a career in a well established and progressive company apply now!

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply.

item.title: Injury Management Advisor
item.description: Join Programmed and set yourself for a future with an industry leader where the opportunities are endless!
item.job:description:
Programmed Skilled Workforce is the leading provider or managed labour, labour hire and staffing services.

We currently have a great job opportunity for an Injury Management Advisor.

Part of a publicly listed group you will be working as part of a team with the support of the Group Regional Workers Compensation Manager and be based in Melbourne's inner East

Reporting to the Group Regional Workers Compensation Manager, this role is very different to a traditional Return to Work Coordinator or Injury Management Advisor role. This position will see you engage and create rapport with injured workers, operational teams at our various sites and third party providers. It will see you spend time out of the office at numerous work sites and medical providers to ensure injured workers are assisted in returning to the workforce as soon as possible.

The main responsibilities of this role are:

  • Promote the goal of zero injuries.
  • Ensure that all injured employees return to work and are assisted to restoration of full function as early as possible after injury.
  • Maintain contact with injured employees.
  • Ensure all claims and claim files are maintained to ensure compliance with relevant legislation and statutory authorities.
  • Work closely with divisions to understand and remove barriers to meaningful return to work.
  • Liaise with the internal and external stakeholders and the HSE teams.
  • Work with various divisions, medical providers, injured employees, Insurers and legal providers.

To be successful in this fantastic opportunity, we are seeking people with experience in the following:

  • Proficient in written & oral communication.
  • Active listening, negotiation, conflict resolution skills.
  • Proficient in use of Microsoft Word & Excel.
  • Excellent time management & multi tasking skills.
  • Experience developing & implementing injury management policy & procedures
  • Proven success in developing Return to Work Plans.
  • Previous claims management experience.
  • Completion of accredited Return to Work Coordinator (RTWC) course.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Previous experience of engagement with injured workers, medical providers, legal and insurance providers.
  • Transport/Logistics, Construction or Manufacturing industry experience ideally suited to this role.
  • Multi-site exposure a definite advantage.

In return the person will be offered an autonomous working environment within a Group Workers Compensation function and a competitive remuneration package.

If you feel you meet the above requirements and seek a career in a well established and progressive company apply now!

Programmed provide a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits, including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

Payroll Officer

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an experienced Payroll Officer to join our Programmed Professionals team in Perth on a permanent full time basis.

item.title: Bid Writer
item.description: Join Programmed and be rewarded for your bid writing skills & experience! Great Company. Great Team. Great Future.
item.job:description:
Programmed Skilled Workforce is Australia's largest provider of managed labour, labour hire and staffing services.

A full time opportunity exists for a Bid Writer to join a successful and growing bid team based in the Hawthorn.

Reporting to the Bid Team Manager you will be responsible for the coordination and writing of small and large tenders and proposals in the staffing services market. The Bid Writer is also responsible for communication materials including sales collateral e.g. presentations, capability statements and case studies.

The roles and responsibilities of the role include:

  • Developing concise, clear and strategic documents in line with client specifications.
  • Ensures that all bid contributors have been fully briefed and are well informed on the submissions required and the contribution deadlines as required.
  • Converting data and reports into meaningful information which supports the bid or presentation.
  • Proof reading content to ensure it is compliant, fit for purpose and error free.
  • Submitting proposals to clients on time and in line with client specifications.
  • Development of tools to support the sales and bid process

item.title: Regional HSE Advisor
item.description: Join our team as a HSE Advisor and enjoy the benefits of working for an industry leader where the opportunities are endless!
item.job:description:
Programmed Facility Management is a leading provider of facility maintenance and asset management, engineering, construction and maintenance services.

An exciting opportunity currently exists for an experienced HSE Advisor to join our team based in Tomago on a Full Time basis.

Reporting to the Business Manager, the HSE Advisor is responsible for championing the implementation, understanding, monitoring and operation of the Company's HSE management system. The role achieves this through a "hands on" approach: training, coaching, mentoring and counselling of appropriate action and behaviours to achieve a safe operating environment and ZERO Harm. The position applies specialist knowledge of HSE legislation and standards, systems policies and protocols to actively assist operations personnel to comply with their HSE obligations.

Key responsibilities of this position include:

  • Support operational personnel in the application of risk management skills that lead to effective hazard identification, elimination/control to maintain a safe work environment in accordance with legal requirements and industry standards
  • Assist in the maintenance and improvement of the Company's HSE system including risk assessment tools, data capture, reporting and documentation
  • Conduct HSE training, audits and inspections as required and keep appropriate records
  • Develop safety communications such as Safety Alerts and Toolbox Talks
  • Actively promote HSE standards to managers, employees, contractors and visitors
  • Accurate recording and reporting of HSE incidents as per Company policy
  • Review incidents and provide technical support for incident investigation
  • Participate in the Company's return to work process and maintain workers compensation documentation as required

To be successful, you will have experience in:

  • HSE qualifications – Certificate IV or Diploma minimum
  • Appropriate training and assessment qualifications
  • Substantial experience in a HSE role
  • Sound understanding of HSE legal obligations
  • Knowledge of and experience in the engineering and industrial sector
  • Return to Work Coordinator qualifications (desirable)
  • Exposure to team based problem solving and lean methodologies (desirable)

This is a challenging role where you can make real contributions to the business, while accessing fantastic opportunities!

If you feel you meet the above requirements and seek a career in a well established and progressive company apply now!

Programmed provide a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits, including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

item.title: Project Supervisor/QA
item.description: Join our team and use your project management skills and experience to drive our team to new heights of success!
item.job:description:
Programmed Facility Management is a leading provider of facility maintenance and asset management, engineering, construction and maintenance services.

A fantastic opportunity exists for a focused and energetic self-starter to join our Canning Vale Office as a Construction Supervisor on a full time basis. Reporting to the Area Coordinator, you will be accountable for project planning, work scheduling and on site supervision of contractors for the delivery of works on time with quality outcomes in a cost effective and safe manner.

If you are a reliable Construction Supervisor that can plan Civil Water and Wastewater construction projects and oversee their progress along the way in a timely and cost-effective manner you need to apply. You will be responsible for budgeting, organisation, implementation and scheduling of the projects. A Construction Coordinator is a key figure of any Service Delivery Team. You will be primarily responsible for the overall successfulness of delivering the construction phase of a project, reaching set targets both safely and correctly.

You must be able to perform effectively within tight time-scales, keep within strict budgets and create a positive client environment such that clients become/remain in a good relationship throughout the contract. They will manage a set of service deliveries, which must be achieved on time to ensure all activities in the schedule are completed in time. 

A Construction Manager will be expected to support the development of the service delivery teams, both on-site and back in the offices. You will need to coordinate with the service delivery team and organise the best team possible to complete the project. Encouragement of excellence and quality in work will lead to a great reputation amongst clients

Responsibilities

  • Oversee and direct construction projects from conception to completion
  • Review the project in-depth to schedule deliverables and estimate costs
  • Oversee all onsite and offsite constructions to monitor compliance with building and safety regulations
  • Coordinate and direct construction workers and subcontractors
  • Select tools, materials and equipment and track inventory
  • Meet contractual conditions of performance
  • Review the work progress on daily basis
  • Prepare internal and external reports pertaining to job status. Report progress on projects by suitable media to sector management, maintain and update project reporting, checkpoints and financial reporting to a high standard
  • Plan ahead to prevent problems and resolve any emerging ones
  • Negotiate terms of agreements, draft contracts and obtain permits and licences
  • Analyse, manage and mitigate risks
  • Ensure quality construction standards and the use of proper construction techniques
  • Plan the delivery of the project at hand.
  • Manage the day-to-day working, utilisation, implementation and contractors engaged on client assignments. From ensuring the correct material turns up before a job, to explaining the work ethics and activities to contractors.
  • Develop contacts with senior staff, directors, and other influential staff within each account during the implementation phase.
  • Co-ordinate required support levels and training.

  Requirements

  • Proven working experience in Water and Wastewater infrastructure construction management
  • Advanced knowledge of construction management processes, means and methods
  • Expert knowledge of building products, construction details and relevant rules, regulations and quality standards
  • Understanding of all facets of the construction process
  • Ability to plan and see the "big picture"
  • Competent in conflict and crisis management
  • Leadership and human resources management skills
  • Excellent time and project management skills

The salary package includes a competitive salary, company vehicle, mobile phone and superannuation.

You should have a strong work ethic and possess leadership qualities in order to take part in future advancement opportunities.

If you feel you meet the above requirements and seek a career in a well established and progressive company apply now!

Programmed provide a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits, including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

  • Recruitment and Retention of Casual Field staff

  • Strong computer and administration skills
  • Strong verbal communication
  • The ability to communicate with a variety of people
  • A current valid driver's License and your own reliable vehicle

item.title: Recruitment Consultant
item.description: Join Programmed Professionals and set yourself for a future with an industry leader where the opportunities are endless!
item.job:description:
A full time position exists within our Professionals division.  The key focus is to provide end to end  recruitment solutions for our major accounts.  

  • Located at Notting Hill, VIC
  • Project Recruitment focus – Hands on!
  • Experienced hands-on experience  is key

In October 2015, the acquisition of SKILLED Group Limited (Skilled) by Programmed Maintenance Services Limited (Programmed) was implemented with Skilled now wholly owned by Programmed.  The new structure establishes Programmed with a national platform, offering Temporary, Permanent and Contract Staffing services, spanning all industries and government. 

Our division is Programmed Professionals which brings together strong brands such as Mosaic Recruitment, Skilled Technical Professionals & Swan Contract Personnel making it one of Australia's largest longest serving professional recruitment providers. 

Located in Notting Hill, our  team is close-knit, hard working and fun, with a real energy and passion for what we do.
 
Your responsibilities will include:

Establishing long-term relationships with clients and  providing candidates and contractors with rewarding and relevant job opportunities ensuring agreed Safety, People, Operational, Sales, Financial and Customer KPI are achieved. The role also provides assistance in supporting business objectives through alignment to the wider Programmed  Group. 

The role will take full responsibility for a specialist area of recruiting expertise, generating business from both new and existing clients, and managing each recruitment assignment through to placement. This role will be measured against pre agreed objectives that are in line with an approved budget in addition to operational excellence. 

To be successful in this role, you will possess the following: 

  • Significant experience in recruitment and communication skills
  • The ability to perform multiple tasks at a consistently high level
  • Maintain customer service and regular contact to achieve and exceed customer satisfaction
  • Articulate and promote the range of recruitment and services to customers
  • Actively source new recruitment opportunities
  • Create and nurture strong client and employee relationships
  • Satisfy all client needs for relevant permanent and contract staff, including fulfilling agreed Client KPIs

This opportunity is suitable for an experienced professional recruiter who wishes to continue their  career in recruitment with a dynamic industry leader. 

You will also possess a passion and motivation to work hard on a daily basis in an incredibly fast paced environment.  
  

Please ensure you speak with your immediate Supervisor/Manager prior to applying. For further information on this position please contact Edwina Mackay  on 0448402510  or email your resume to:-  Edwina.mackay@programmedprofessionals.com.au

item.title: Senior Maximo Administrator
item.description: Join Programmed and set yourself in the direction for success! Great team, endless support and fantastic employee benefits!
item.job:description:
Programmed Facility Management is a leading provider of facility maintenance and asset management, engineering, construction and maintenance services.

Our uncompromising commitment to health and safety, creating value and sustainability means that we are regularly chosen by many of the largest and most prestigious organisations as their facilities and asset management partner.

We are currently seeking a Maximo Administrator to join our Operational Excellence team based in Melbourne CBD. This is a full time, 12 month contract position and will be reporting to the Maximo Systems Manager.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Advanced SQL skills.
  • Experience in implementing business solutions such as ERP, CRM, Financial or BI
  • Previous experience in a Business Analyst/Systems Analyst role
  • Experience in producing a traceability matrix, writing test plans and test cases as well as involvement in most test phases of a system implementation project
  • BIRT reporting experience
  • Skills with Maximo configurations and migration across environments (desirable).

If you believe you meet the above requirements and would be a great fit for this varied role, don't delay – apply online today!

Programmed provides a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply.

item.title: Account Manager
item.description: Are you passionate about delivering exceptional service standards and are currently looking for a new and exciting career challenge. Apply now!
item.job:description:
Programmed Skilled Workforce are currently seeking an enthusiastic Account Manager to join their Major Accounts Sales and Service Team, based in Sydney Metro Area on a full time basis.

Reporting to the Major Accounts Delivery Manager, your primary focus will be to manage a client portfolio and executing safety on site across the major accounts team. This is a great opportunity for someone who is looking to take that next step in their career. The ability to illustrate a strong desire to learn, attention to detail and a strong work ethic is highly desired.

Ideally you will possess Recruitment Industry experience; however applicants will be considered from Sales and Customer Service background.

To be successful in this position, you will:

  • Deliver service excellence to all clients whilst displaying outstanding relationship skills
  • Have strong communication skills - both written and verbal
  • Be approachable and confident in dealing with a variety of people
  • Problem resolution skills
  • Excellent time management skills
  • Have strong computer literacy in Microsoft suite
  • Hold a current NSW drivers Licence and own a reliable car.

In return for your strong work ethic, you will be rewarded with a friendly, fast-paced working environment, as well as the opportunity for career development. This roles attracts a competitive salary package which will consist of a base salary, car allowance, company laptop and phone.

This is a challenging role for a resilient and motivated individual with a desire to succeed in the labour hire Industry.

If this sounds like your next career move and you meet the above criteria, don't delay, apply today

Programmed provide a supportive work environment with a variety of employment benefits, including access to a discount benefit scheme, paid parental leave and employee share plan.

Programmed supports a workplace culture of zero harm and encourages this in all that we do.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders are encouraged to apply.
